body_html:
I think that I've found why. nvcc in CUDA 8 for macOS cannot digest string.h if command line tools for Xcode 9 have been installed earlier:

‣ cat > test.cu
#include <string.h>

‣ nvcc test.cu
nvcc warning : The 'compute_20', 'sm_20', and 'sm_21' architectures are deprecated, and may be removed in a future release (Use -Wno-deprecated-gpu-targets to suppress warning).
/usr/include/string.h(170): error: extra text after expected end of number

/usr/include/string.h(171): error: extra text after expected end of number

2 errors detected in the compilation of "/var/folders/4f/97nl_7m55ydcm83p2dplq93h0000gn/T//tmpxft_00004223_00000000-9_test.cpp1.ii".

Typically, nvcc does not cause a problem if I switch to Xcode 8 via xcode-select, but I was not lucky due to string.h this time. I downloaded and reinstalled "Command Line Tools macOS 10.12 for Xcode 8.2", and then I no longer see this issue.

body:
I think that I've found why.  nvcc in CUDA 8 for macOS cannot digest `string.h` if command line tools for Xcode 9 have been installed earlier:

```
‣ cat > test.cu
#include <string.h>

‣ nvcc test.cu
nvcc warning : The 'compute_20', 'sm_20', and 'sm_21' architectures are deprecated, and may be removed in a future release (Use -Wno-deprecated-gpu-targets to suppress warning).
/usr/include/string.h(170): error: extra text after expected end of number

/usr/include/string.h(171): error: extra text after expected end of number

2 errors detected in the compilation of "/var/folders/4f/97nl_7m55ydcm83p2dplq93h0000gn/T//tmpxft_00004223_00000000-9_test.cpp1.ii".
```

Typically, nvcc does not cause a problem if I switch to Xcode 8 via `xcode-select`, but I was not lucky due to `string.h` this time. I downloaded and reinstalled "Command Line Tools macOS 10.12 for Xcode 8.2", and then I no longer see this issue.
